text: two drinks in the first hour may not
really create much intoxication the rate
of intoxication differs between males
and females and between people different
body types and weight the general rule
of thumb for people when they are out
drinking is that if you are drinking
more than one drink in an hour you are
slowly getting yourself intoxicated so
two drinks and the first hour may not
really create much intoxication but if
you've had four by the end of the second
hour you probably are feeling buzzed and
it probably should not be driving a car
the issue I think we're where people get
into most trouble is when they're binge
drinking so binge drinking in that case
is you might have three or four drinks
in an hour and then kind of keep that
pace up over several hours oftentimes by
the end of the evening you are severely
intoxicated but generally the rule of
thumb is if you keep it within one drink
per hour you're you're not going to get
intoxicated
